entity.name: Countryfile Diaries
entity.description: A sister show to the BBC's `Countryfile' series, this rural affairs programme sees a team of presenters travel the length and breadth of the United Kingdom to cover stories related to the British countryside and the season of spring. As this period is a busy time of the year for the farming and outdoor communities in particular, regular topics covered include the production of food, nature conservation, and a look at a chosen area's culture and history. Stunning landscapes and a variety of wildlife also feature prominently.

text: @timsmithyorks @DonnellyDan @EnvAgencyYNE I would think it'll be rebuilt in time. Can't help but think the vibrations installing the shuttering for the fish pass caused the damage.
@DavidJCoupland @DonnellyDan @EnvAgencyYNE There aren‚Äôt any on the Bramley side, at least not for quite a way. I‚Äôm hoping those of us on the other side are far enough away. ü§ûüèº
RT @timsmithyorks: Look at the damage caused to the weir on the River Aire near us, presumably by weeks of heavy rain. Levels now lower tha‚Ä¶
@DonnellyDan @DavidJCoupland @EnvAgencyYNE Some of our neighbours are questioning the need for a fish pass now there‚Äôs a hole in the weir. One for @EnvAgencyYNE and others I suspect.

@timsmithyorks @DonnellyDan @EnvAgencyYNE The excavator was moving bits about yesterday. Not sure if was clearing the riverside knowing that they could be washed away. I'm wondering if the change in flow will affect the houses close by?

Full report from @EnvAgency here:
https://t.co/A6zvWYQpaB
@timsmithyorks @DavidJCoupland @EnvAgencyYNE That side has been excavated for the installation of a fish pass - wonder if that has been wrecked . Might take a wander down later. Very sad.
RT @LancashireCC: The brand new #Landscapes2Lifescapes digital exhibition can be found on the ‚ÄòLearning‚Äô page of #TheFloodHub. Check it out‚Ä¶

@DonnellyDan @DavidJCoupland @EnvAgencyYNE Quite a bit of land on the Bramley side of the river has already been washed away. And if the tree in the footage moves downstream it‚Äôll cause serious damage.
